intro: Aylostera yuquinensis, commonly known as the Yuquin aster, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually purple or blue, with yellow centers, and bloom in the summer months. Aylostera yuquinensis is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
